steps_basic.title: Prepare your target stick
steps_basic.instruction: Get a chopstick, pencil, or any stick. This will be your target stick.
steps_basic.hint: Any stick-like object works - even a pen!

steps_basic.title: Show the stick to your bird
steps_basic.instruction: Hold the stick near your bird (not touching). Let them see it and get curious.
steps_basic.hint: Don't push it towards them - let them come to it naturally.

steps_basic.title: Wait for curiosity
steps_basic.instruction: When your bird looks at or moves toward the stick, say 'Good!' and give a treat.
steps_basic.hint: Reward ANY interest in the stick, even just looking at it.

steps_basic.title: Practice 5 times
steps_basic.instruction: Repeat: show stick → bird shows interest → 'Good!' + treat. Do this 5 times.
steps_basic.hint: Keep sessions short - birds learn better in small doses.

steps_intermediate.title: Review Basic
steps_intermediate.instruction: Make sure your bird is comfortable looking at the stick and getting treats.
steps_intermediate.hint: If they're not interested, go back to Basic level.

steps_intermediate.title: Wait for a beak touch
steps_intermediate.instruction: Now only reward when your bird's BEAK touches the stick. Say 'Touch!' then 'Good!' + treat.
steps_intermediate.hint: Be patient - they'll eventually touch it out of curiosity.

steps_intermediate.title: Add the cue word
steps_intermediate.instruction: Say 'Touch!' BEFORE presenting the stick. Bird touches → 'Good!' + treat.
steps_intermediate.hint: The word 'Touch!' will become the command.

steps_intermediate.title: Practice in different spots
steps_intermediate.instruction: Move the stick to different positions - left, right, up, down. Say 'Touch!' each time.
steps_intermediate.hint: This teaches them to touch the stick wherever it is.

steps_intermediate.title: 10 successful touches
steps_intermediate.instruction: Practice until your bird reliably touches the stick 10 times in a row.
steps_intermediate.hint: Celebrate each success! Birds love enthusiasm.

steps_advanced.title: Review Intermediate
steps_advanced.instruction: Your bird should now touch the stick reliably when you say 'Touch!'
steps_advanced.hint: If not consistent, practice Intermediate level more.

steps_advanced.title: Fade the food lure
steps_advanced.instruction: Start rewarding only every OTHER successful touch. Keep praising verbally.
steps_advanced.hint: This teaches them to work for praise, not just treats.

steps_advanced.title: Add distance
steps_advanced.instruction: Hold the stick further away. Say 'Touch!' - bird should move to touch it.
steps_advanced.hint: Start with just a few inches further, then gradually increase.

steps_advanced.title: Combine with movement
steps_advanced.instruction: Move the stick slowly while saying 'Touch!' - bird should follow and touch it.
steps_advanced.hint: This is the foundation for 'follow' and 'come' commands!

steps_advanced.title: Master level test
steps_advanced.instruction: Can your bird touch the stick 15 times in different locations with only occasional treats?
steps_advanced.hint: If yes, congratulations! Your bird has mastered target training!
